education.title: Beware Scams Library
education.subtitle: Real-world examples to help you identify fraud.

digitalArrest.title: Digital Arrest Scam
digitalArrest.description: Scammers pose as CBI, Police, or Narcotics officials via video call (Skype/WhatsApp). They claim a parcel with drugs/passports is addressed to you and demand money to avoid arrest.
redFlags: Video call interrogation (Police never do this)

upi.title: UPI Refund / QR Code Scam
upi.description: Fraudsters on OLX/Facebook Marketplace claim they want to send you money. They ask you to scan a QR code or enter your UPI PIN to 'receive' the payment.
redFlags: Asking for PIN to RECEIVE money

electricity.title: Electricity Bill Scam
electricity.description: You receive an SMS: 'Your power will be cut tonight at 9:30 PM due to unpaid bill. Call this number.' The person asks you to download an app like AnyDesk to 'update KYC'.

job.title: Part-time Job / Telegram Scam
job.description: Offers of 'Work from Home' for rating hotels or videos. They pay small amounts initially to build trust, then ask you to invest money for 'prepaid tasks' which gets blocked.
redFlags: Too good to be true earnings
Asking for investment to get salary

apk.title: APK / Malicious App Scam
apk.description: A link is sent claiming to be a bank update, reward, or explicit content. Downloading the .apk file installs malware that steals your OTPs and reads your notifications.

sextortion.title: Sextortion
sextortion.description: A stranger video calls you, plays an obscene video, and captures your face. They then threaten to upload the morphed video to YouTube/Social Media unless you pay.
